sentence.Network_en: Sirrah , by my fay , it waxes late. ( Shakespeare ).
sentence.Network_cn: 小子, 老实说,天不早了.

sentence.Network_en: Sirrah, fetch drier logs: Call Peter, he will show thee where they are.
sentence.Network_cn: 喂,木头要拣干燥点儿的, 你去问彼得, 他可以告诉你什么地方有.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: probably from sire, when still two syllables in Middle English, with the second syllable assimilated to ah

means.word_mean: 1. formerly a contemptuous term of address to an inferior man or boy; often used in anger
